FuncDef:
The cpu-defend-policy command applies an attack defense policy to the interface board.
The undo cpu-defend-policy command restores the default configuration.
By default, no attack defense policy is applied to the interface board.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of the attack defense policy to be applied. The attack defense policy must be an existing one.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 30.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To apply the specified attack defense policy to an interface board, you need to run the cpu-defend-policy command on the interface board to bind the specified attack defense policy to the interface board. If the cpu-defend-policy command is not run, the default attack defense policy is applied to the interface board.
Prerequisites
The attack defense policy specified by policy-number must be an existing one; otherwise, it cannot be applied to an interface board.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
